title: Control Teleport
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| [![Control teleport.png](/images/5/52/Control_teleport.png)](/File:Control_teleport.png) Control Teleport |                                                                                                                    |
| :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Level                                                                                                     | 4                                                                                                                  |
| School1                                                                                                   | [Charms](/Charms "Charms")                                                                                         |
| School2                                                                                                   | [Translocation](/Translocations "Translocations")                                                                  |
| Source(s)                                                                                                 | - [Book of the Warp](/Book_of_the_Warp "Book of the Warp")
- [Book of Control](/Book_of_Control "Book of Control") |
| [Casting noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                               | 3                                                                                                                  |
| [Spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                                 | 0                                                                                                                  |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | This spell allows the caster to control their next translocation – either by selecting an approximate target for a teleport, or by selecting a direction for a blink. Be wary that controlled translocations will cause the subject to become contaminated with magical energy, and that controlled teleports will take longer to trigger than uncontrolled ones. |

**Control Teleport** is a level 4 [Charms](/Charms "Charms")/[Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") spell which temporarily grants the caster the [teleport control](/Teleport_control "Teleport control") (cTele) [status effect](/Status_effect "Status effect"). When [teleporting](/Teleport "Teleport") with this status, you can choose a specific location, and you will land within 2 tiles of that square (heavily favoring 1 tile away). However, the teleport is delayed by `1d3` turns. When making an uncontrolled [blink](/Blink "Blink"), you'll be sent 2-7 squares in a direction of your choosing.

The status wears off after you make 1 teleport or blink. Be aware that it will cause some [magic contamination](/Magic_contamination "Magic contamination").

## History

- This spell was removed in [0.17](/0.17 "0.17").
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), the cTele status didn't wear off after a teleport/blink; you could perform multiple controlled teleports with a single cast. Also, controlled teleports didn't delay teleports.
html:
Control Teleport

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
 Control Teleport
Level 4
School1 Charms
School2 Translocation
Source(s)
  • Book of the Warp
  • Book of Control
Casting noise 3
Spell noise 0
This spell allows the caster to control their next translocation – either by selecting an approximate target for a teleport, or by selecting a direction for a blink. Be wary that controlled translocations will cause the subject to become contaminated with magical energy, and that controlled teleports will take longer to trigger than uncontrolled ones.

Control Teleport is a level 4 Charms/Translocations spell which temporarily grants the caster the teleport control (cTele) status effect. When teleporting with this status, you can choose a specific location, and you will land within 2 tiles of that square (heavily favoring 1 tile away). However, the teleport is delayed by 1d3 turns. When making an uncontrolled blink, you'll be sent 2-7 squares in a direction of your choosing.

The status wears off after you make 1 teleport or blink. Be aware that it will cause some magic contamination.

History

  • This spell was removed in 0.17.
  • Prior to 0.13, the cTele status didn't wear off after a teleport/blink; you could perform multiple controlled teleports with a single cast. Also, controlled teleports didn't delay teleports.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Control_Teleport&oldid=71761"

When [[teleport]]ing with this status, you can choose a specific location, and you will land within 2 tiles of that square (heavily favoring 1 tile away). However, the teleport is delayed by 1d3 turns. When making an uncontrolled [[blink]], you'll be sent 2-7 squares in a direction of your choosing. The status wears off after you make 1 teleport or blink. Be aware that it will cause some [[magic contamination]]. ==History== * This spell was removed in [[0.17]]. * Prior to [[0.13]], the cTele status didn't wear off after a teleport/blink; you could perform multiple controlled teleports with a single cast. Also, controlled teleports didn't delay teleports. [[Category:Obsolete spells]]
